member.summary: This property must be set when the property is set to select the user security context in which the internal browser will run. If the user is not part of a Windows domain the machine name must be used as domain name. The default property value is empty

member.name: P:HiQPdf.BrowserImpersonation.Password

member.name: P:HiQPdf.BrowserImpersonation.AutoLogon
member.summary: This property has effect only when is also set. It controls if the logon of the user is automatic or explicit. The default property value is true

member.summary: The maximum time in seconds to wait for HTML document to be loaded. The default value is 120 seconds. An exception is thrown if the HTML document cannot be loaded in HtmlLoadedTimeout seconds

member.summary: This property can be set with a value representing the CSS selector of the HTML element to be converted. If many elements in the HTML document are selected, only the the first one will be converted. The values of the attributes in the CSS selectors are case sensitive. If this property is not set then the whole HTML document is converted

member.summary: The browser window width in pixels. The default width is 1200 pixels

member.summary: The browser window height in pixels. The default height is set to render the entire HTML document

member.summary: The default character set to be used when the character set meta tag is not set in HTML document header

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlConverterBase.MaxBrowserHeight
member.summary: This property can be used to set a maximum limit in pixels for the rendered top part of a HTML document. The default value is 0 and the height is not limited

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlConverterBase.MinBrowserHeight
member.summary: This property can be used to set a minimum height in pixels to be rendered. The default value is 0 pixels. This property is ignored when the property is set

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlConverterBase.StartBrowserHeight
member.summary: This property can be used to set the starting height in pixels of the browser. This property is ignored when the property is set

member.summary: The maximum height in pixels of the image tiles captured by converter

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlConverterBase.Authentication

member.summary: The object exposed by this propery encapsulates the properties controlling the internal browser impersonation

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlConverterBase.Proxy
member.summary: The object exposed by this property encapsulates the parameters (address, username, password) that can be used to access web pages through a proxy server

member.summary: A collection of the HTTP headers to be used when accessing a web page

member.summary: This property controls if the headers defined by the property are also used when accessing the resources referenced by the web page, not only when accessing the web page. The default value is true and the headers are repeated when accessing the referenced resources

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlConverterBase.HttpCookies
member.summary: A collection of HTTP cookies to be used when accessing a web page

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlConverterBase.HttpPostFields
member.summary: A collection of HTTP POST fields to be used when accessing a web page. If the collection is not empty, the converter will make a POST request to the web page URL with the fields from this collection

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlConverterBase.MediaType
member.summary: Controls the media type for which to render the HTML document. If this property is null or empty the default media type is 'screen'. It can be set to a value like 'print' and in this case the CSS properties defined by the '@media print' rule will be used when the HTML is rendered

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlConverterBase.RenderSvgFonts
member.summary: Controls if the SVG fonts are rendered. The default value is false when converting HTML to PDF or SVG and true when converting HTML to a raster image

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlConverterBase.RenderWebFonts
member.summary: Controls if the Web Fonts are rendered. The default value is true

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlConverterBase.LayoutWithHinting
member.summary: Controls if the hinting is used to layout HTML. Layout hinting is disabled by default. Enabling this property can improve the layout but it can make the conversion slower

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlConverterBase.RunJavaScript
member.summary: Controls if the JavaScript in the HTML document is executed. The default value of this property is true and the JavaScript is executed

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlConverterBase.RunExtensions
member.summary: Controls if the browser extensions like Flash players are executed. The default value is false and no extension is executed

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlConverterBase.StopSlowScripts
member.summary: Controls if the browser should interrupt slow scripts in the web page. The default value is false and the scripts are not stopped

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlConverterBase.ForceResourcesDownload
member.summary: Controls if the HTML converter should force all possible resources to be downloaded. The default value is false

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlConverterBase.ProbeLayout
member.summary: Controls if the HTML converter should do a probe layout first. The default value is true

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlObjectBase.MinBrowserHeight

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlObjectBase.StartBrowserHeight
member.summary: This property can be used to set the starting height in pixels of the browser. This property is ignored when the property is set

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlObjectBase.MaxImageTileHeight
member.summary: The maximum height in pixels of the image tiles captured by converter in this HTML object

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlObjectBase.TrimToBrowserWidth
member.summary: If the HTML document cannot be entirely displayed in pixels and the TrimToBrowserWidth is false then the browser window width will be automatically set to display the entire HTML document in this HTML object. If the HTML document cannot be entirely displayed in pixels and the TrimToBrowserWidth is true then the browser window width will not be automatically set to display the entire HTML document and the HTML document will be trimmed

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlObjectBase.Authentication
member.summary: The object exposed by this propery encapsulates a username and a password that can be used to access web pages requiring HTTP authentication in this HTML object

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlObjectBase.Impersonation
member.summary: The object exposed by this propery encapsulates the properties controlling the internal browser impersonation in this HTML object

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlObjectBase.Proxy
member.summary: The object exposed by this property encapsulates the parameters (address, username, password) that can be used to access web pages through a proxy server in this HTML object

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlObjectBase.HttpHeaders
member.summary: A collection of the HTTP headers to be used when accessing a web page in this HTML object

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlObjectBase.RepeatHttpHeaders
member.summary: This property controls if the headers defined by the property are also used when accessing the resources referenced by the web page, not only when accessing the web page in this HTML object. The default value is true and the headers are repeated when accessing the referenced resources

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlObjectBase.HttpCookies
member.summary: A collection of HTTP cookies to be used when accessing a web page in this HTML object

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlObjectBase.HttpPostFields
member.summary: A collection of HTTP POST fields to be used when accessing a web page in this HTML object. If the collection is not empty, the converter will make a POST request to the web page URL with the fields from this collection.

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlObjectBase.MediaType
member.summary: Controls the media type for which to render the HTML document in this HTML object. If this property is null or empty the default media type is 'screen'. It can be set to a value like 'print' and in this case the CSS properties defined by the '@media print' rule will be used when the HTML is rendered

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlObjectBase.RenderSvgFonts
member.summary: Controls if the SVG fonts are rendered in this HTML object. The default value is false when converting HTML to PDF or SVG and true when converting HTML to a raster image

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlObjectBase.RenderWebFonts
member.summary: Controls if the Web Fonts are rendered in this HTML object. The default value is true

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlObjectBase.LayoutWithHinting
member.summary: Controls if the hinting is used to layout HTML in this HTML object. Layout hinting is disabled by default. Enabling this property can improve the layout but it can make the conversion slower

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlObjectBase.SelectedHtmlElements
member.summary: An array of HTML CSS selectors to select the HTML elements for which to retrieve detailed information in collection exposed by property in this HTML object

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlObjectBase.RetrieveExcludedElements
member.summary: Controls if the HTML elements excluded from rendering can be selected for detailed information retrieval. This property is true by default

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlObjectBase.RunJavaScript
member.summary: Controls if the JavaScript in the HTML document is executed in this HTML object. The default value of this property is true and the JavaScript is executed

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlObjectBase.RunExtensions
member.summary: Controls if the browser extensions like Flash players are executed in this HTML object. The default value is false and no extension is executed

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlObjectBase.StopSlowScripts
member.summary: Controls if the browser should interrupt slow scripts in the web page in this HTML object. The default value is false and the scripts are not stopped

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlObjectBase.ForceResourcesDownload
member.summary: Controls if the HTML converter object should force all possible resources to be downloaded in this HTML object. The default value is false

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlObjectBase.ProbeLayout
member.summary: Controls if the HTML converter object should do a probe layout first in this HTML object. The default value is true

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlObjectBase.Outlines
member.summary: Controls the outlines automatically generated by this HTML object

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlObjectBase.FitDestWidth
member.summary: Controls if the content is scaled down to fit the PDF destination width of this HTML object. This property is true by default. When this property is true the images and the text font can be smaller than in HTML

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlObjectBase.FitDestHeight
member.summary: Controls if the content is scaled down to fit the PDF destination height iof this HTML object. This property is false by default

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlObjectBase.ForceFitDestWidth
member.summary: Controls if the content can be enlarged to fit the PDF destination width of this HTML object when is true. This property is false by default

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlObjectBase.ConvertHttpLinks
member.summary: Controls if the HTTP links in the HTML document are converted to HTTP links in PDF in this HTML object. This property is true by default

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlObjectBase.LiveExcludedElements
member.summary: Controls if the HTML elements excluded from rendering are live in PDF. This property is false by default

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlObjectBase.ConvertInternalLinks
member.summary: Controls if the internal links in HTML are converted to internal links in PDF in this HTML object. This property is true by default

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlObjectBase.ImagesCutAllowed
member.summary: Controls if cutting images between PDF pages is permitted. This property is true by default

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlObjectBase.BreakInsideAvoidHtmlElements
member.summary: An array of HTML CSS selectors to select the HTML elements not accepting page breaks inside them

member.name: P:HiQPdf.HtmlObjectBase.BreakAfterHtmlElements
member.summary: An array of HTML CSS selectors to select the HTML elements that will receive a page break after them in PDF document

member.name: T:HiQPdf.PdfHtmlWithPlaceHolders
member.summary: An object of this class can be laid out in any position in a to render in place HTML content which may contain the page numbering place holders {CrtPage} and {PageCount}. The rendering of this type of object can be less efficient than the rendering of a regular object because there will be a HTML to PDF conversion for each PDF page where the canvas is repeated

member.name: T:HiQPdf.PdfHtml
member.summary: An object of this class can be laid out in any position in a PDF document to render HTML content in place. Multiple objects of this type can be laid out in the same PDF page and even overlapped. If there is no background defined in the HTML document then the background of the rendered content in PDF will be transparent, making visible the existing content under it

member.name: T:HiQPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags
member.summary: The submit form action flags that can be combined to specify various characteristics of the action

member.name: F:HiQPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags.Default
member.summary: The default value of the flags

member.name: F:HiQPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags.IncludeExclude
member.summary: If clear, the Fields array specifies which fields to include in the submission. If set, the Fields array tells which fields to exclude

member.name: F:HiQPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags.IncludeNoValueFields
member.summary: If set, all fields designated by the Fields array and the Include/Exclude flag shall be submitted, regardless of whether they have a value. For fields without a value, only the field name shall betransmitted. If clear, fields without a value shall not be submitted

member.name: F:HiQPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags.ExportFormat
member.summary: Meaningful only if the SubmitPDF and XFDF flags are clear. If set, field names and values shall be submitted in HTML Form format. If clear, they shall be submitted in Forms Data Format

member.name: F:HiQPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags.GetMethod
member.summary: If set, field names and values shall be submitted using an HTTP GET request. If clear, they shall be submitted using a POST request. This flag is meaningful only when the ExportFormat flag is set; if ExportFormat is clear, this flag shall also be clear

member.name: F:HiQPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags.SubmitCoordinates
member.summary: If set, the coordinates of the mouse click that caused the submit-form action shall be transmitted as part of the form data. The coordinate values are relative to the upper-left corner of the field’s widget annotation rectangle. This flag shall be used only when the ExportFormat flag is set. If ExportFormat is clear, this flag shall also be clear

member.name: F:HiQPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags.XFDF
member.summary: Shall be used only if the SubmitPDF flags are clear. If set, field names and values shall be submitted as XFDF

member.name: F:HiQPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags.IncludeAppendSaves
member.summary: Shall be used only when the form is being submitted in Forms Data Format (that is, when both the XFDF and ExportFormat flags are clear). If set, the submitted FDF file shall include the contents of all incremental updates to the underlying PDF document, as contained in the Differences entry in the FDF dictionary. If clear, the incremental updates shall not be included

member.name: F:HiQPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags.IncludeAnnotations
member.summary: Shall be used only when the form is being submitted in Forms Data Format (that is, when both the XFDF and ExportFormat flags are clear). If set, the submitted FDF file shall include includes all markup annotations in the underlying PDF document. If clear, markup annotations shall not be included

member.name: F:HiQPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags.SubmitPDF
member.summary: If set, the document shall be submitted as PDF, using the MIME content type application/pdf. If set, all other flags shall be ignored except GetMethod

member.name: F:HiQPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags.CanonicalFormat
member.summary: If set, any submitted field values representing dates shall be converted to the standard format

member.name: F:HiQPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags.ExclNonUserAnnots
member.summary: Shall be used only when the form is being submitted in Forms Data Format (that is, when both the XFDF and ExportFormat flags are clear) and the IncludeAnnotations flag is set. If set, it shall include only those markup annotations whose T entry matches the name of the current user, as determined by the remote server to which the form is being submitted.

member.name: F:HiQPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags.ExclFKey
member.summary: Shall be used only when the form is being submitted in Forms Data Format (that is, when both the XFDF and ExportFormat flags are clear). If set, the submitted FDF shall exclude the F entry.

member.name: F:HiQPdf.PdfFormSubmitFlags.EmbedForm
member.summary: Shall be used only when the form is being submitted in Forms Data Format (that is, when both the XFDF and ExportFormat flags are clear). If set, the F entry of the submitted FDF shall be a file specification containing an embedded file stream representing the PDF file from which the FDF is being submitted

member.name: E:HiQPdf.PdfHtmlImage.PageLayoutingEvent
member.summary: The event is raised when the HTML to Image object prepares to layout the objects in a PDF page. This event can be used to layout PDF objects in the background of the PDF page before the main HTML content is laid out in page. The event handler must be set before adding this object to a page

member.name: E:HiQPdf.PdfHtmlImage.PageLayoutingEndedEvent
member.summary: The event is raised after the converter finished to layout the objects in a PDF page. This event can be used to layout PDF objects in the foreground of the PDF page after the main HTML content was laid out in page. The event handler must be set before adding this object to a page

member.summary: Controls if the alpha blending is enabled when drawing this image in PDF. This property is true by default

member.name: P:HiQPdf.PdfImage.Cropping
member.summary: Controls is the image is cropped at the end of PDF page where it is rendered. This property is false by default and the image can continue on the next page if necessary

member.name: P:HiQPdf.PdfImage.MultiPage
member.summary: Controls if the all the frames in the image are rendered in PDF. This property is true by default and each frame in the image is rendered in a new PDF page

member.name: P:HiQPdf.PdfImage.PreserveAspectRatio
member.summary: Controls if the aspect ratio of the image is preserved in PDF. This property is true by default

member.name: P:HiQPdf.PdfImage.CanGrow
member.summary: Controls if the image can grow to fit the destination in PDF. This property is true by default

member.name: P:HiQPdf.PdfImage.SelectedFrame
member.summary: The index of the frame in a multi frame image selected for rendering. This property is 0 by default and has effect only when property is false

member.name: P:HiQPdf.PdfImage.ForceNewPdfPages
member.summary: Controls if a new PDF page is always created when the image object is laid out on the next PDF page. By default this property is false and if there is a next page already created in PDF document it will be used to layout this object

member.name: T:HiQPdf.PdfSecurity
member.summary: Controls the security attributes of the generated PDF document

member.name: P:HiQPdf.PdfSecurity.EncryptionLevel
member.summary: Controls the encryption level. When the level is High a 128-bit key is used for RC4 encryption, otherwise a 40-bit key is used. The encryption is High by default

member.name: P:HiQPdf.PdfSecurity.PermissionsPassword
member.summary: Controls the password to open the PDF document as owner. The owner has the right to open the document and to change the PDF document permissions in a PDF editor

member.name: P:HiQPdf.PdfSecurity.OpenPassword
member.summary: Controls the password to open the PDF document

member.name: P:HiQPdf.PdfSecurity.AllowPrinting
member.summary: Controls if printing the PDF document is allowed. This property is true by default

member.name: P:HiQPdf.PdfSecurity.AllowAssembling
member.summary: Controls if the assembling operations are allowed for the generated PDF document when the document is strongly encrypted. Assembling operations are insert, rotate or delete pages and create bookmarks or thumbnail images. This property is true by default

member.name: P:HiQPdf.PdfSecurity.AllowCopyContent
member.summary: Controls if copying or extracting text and graphics from the document is allowed. This property is true by default

member.name: P:HiQPdf.PdfSecurity.AllowEditAnnotations
member.summary: Controls if it is allowed to add or modify text annotations or to fill in interactive form fields. If both this property and are true then it is also allowed create or modify interactive form fields (including signature fields). This property is true by default

member.name: P:HiQPdf.PdfSecurity.AllowEditContent
member.summary: Controls if it is allowed to modify the contents of the document by operations other than those controlled by and . This property is true by default

member.name: P:HiQPdf.PdfSecurity.AllowFormFilling
member.summary: If this property is true then it is allowed to fill the PDF form even if is false. When this property, and are false the form filling is not allowed.

member.summary: The PDF standard used to generate the document

member.summary: The created PDF document will be conform to PDF/A-1b standard

member.name: F:HiQPdf.PdfStandard.PdfX
member.summary: The created PDF document will be conform to PDF/X-1a standard

member.name: P:HiQPdf.PdfViewer.FitWindow
member.summary: Controls if the document window is resized to fit the size of the first displayed page. This property is false by default

member.name: P:HiQPdf.PdfViewer.CenterWindow
member.summary: Controls is the document window is positioned in the center of the screen when the PDF document is displayed. This property is false by default

member.name: P:HiQPdf.PdfViewer.DisplayDocTitle
member.summary: Controls if the window title bar should display the document title. This property is false by default

member.name: P:HiQPdf.PdfViewer.ExitFullScreenPageMode
member.summary: Controls how to display the document on exiting full screen mode. This property is None by default

member.name: P:HiQPdf.PdfViewer.Direction
member.summary: Controls the reading order for text. This property is LeftToRight by default

member.name: P:HiQPdf.PdfViewer.PageMode
member.summary: Controls how the document will be displayed when opened. This property is None by default

member.name: P:HiQPdf.PdfViewer.PageLayout
member.summary: Controls the page layout to be used when the document is opened. This property is OneColumn by default

member.name: T:HiQPdf.PdfReadingOrder
member.summary: The reading order when the document is displayed

member.name: F:HiQPdf.PdfReadingOrder.LeftToRight
member.summary: Left to right

member.name: F:HiQPdf.PdfReadingOrder.RightToLeft
member.summary: Right to left
